summary: This mods adds a Stormcloak and Imperial variant for every Armor type in the game. It\'s fully craftable and upgradeable, with the required perks, of course. Now you can let those Imperials/Stormcloaks see your true allegiance while still being protected.
descriptionHtml:
Introduction
--------------------
This mods adds a Stormcloak and Imperial variant for every (better) Armor type and an Imperial sword and bow for every (better) weapon material in the game. It\'s fully craftable and upgradeable, with the required perks, of course. Now you can let those Imperials/Stormcloaks see your true allegiance while still being protected.

Why?
--------
I always felt that I should wear my Civil War armor when I was on a mission for the Civil War, but when I did, I immediatly felt that I was underprotected. If you feel the same way and want a solution to this, this is the mod for you!

Installation
---------------
I recommend using the NMM for easy installing. If you want to use manual installation however, it\'s very easy. Just extract everything (which is just one file) to your Skyrim/Data folder.

Uninstallation
------------------
Using the NMM you can just remove the file. If you installed it manually, delete BetterStormcloakArmor.esp. (it\'s called this way because it used to be Stormcloak only)

Change Log
---------------
-v3.0: Added Heavy Stormcloak Armor, renamed the Sleeved Stormcloak armor to avoid confusion and fixed the Heavy Armor not working with Fists Of Steel 
-2.1: Added Imperial sword and bow
-2.0: Added Better Imperial Armor
-1.2: Added Stormcloak Officer Armor
-1.1: Added reaction for Captain Aldis while wearing better Stormcloak armor
-1.0: Initial release

Permission
---------------
If someone wants to use this mod (for a bigger Civil War Overhaul for example), just ask and there is a very high chance that you will get my permission.

Credits
-----------
Bethesda - For making such a great game and for giving us the Creation Kit.


Please, rate and comment. If you find any of the citizens of Skyrim reacting only to original Civil War armor, or other issues with this mod, please let me know so I can fix it. 

Also Available on the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=21177&searchtext=]Steam Workshop[/url] (I still recommend using the Nexus)
author: Jonaman8
